alert.note: Alert for Leon (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 5:27PM EDT until July 30 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN LEON COUNTY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Central and Southern Leon County in the Florida Big Bend. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 526 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tallahassee, Woodville, Florida A and M, Florida State University, Tallahassee Community College, Doak Campbell Stadium, Lake Munson, Gaither Community Center, Springsax Park, North Florida Fairgrounds, Gene Cox Stadium, Eight Mile Pond, Jack McLean Park, Walker Ford Community Center, Callen Neighborhood, Apalachee Ridge Estates, South City, Providence Neighborhood, Lake Bradford and Bragg Stadium. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
